page.title: 14Historic buildings.
page.content: In Much Wenlock there are many {buildings}of historic interest. Two of these buildings are{The Guildhall}and {The Corn Exchange. {The number of tourists}visiting{The {Guildhall}each year is approximately {3,500. The Guildhall}was started in {1540}and built as a{court house.}Many additions have been made over the years. The Guildhall stands on pillars, with a butter market and jail underneath.{The court sessions}and the {Council meetings}are still held{every {month}in this building. The building of{The Corn Exchange}was begun in{1852.}Apart from providing a {covered Corn Market,}this building was also used to house the books of{The {Wenlock Agricultural Reading Society set up by{Dr. William Penny Brookes. This building is now used as a{public {library}with an{Archive Room}above.
